post.description:
Create a new video library within your Tenbyte account.
Libraries are used to organize video assets, folders, and related webhooks.

name.description: The display name of the library. This identifies the library.

region.description: Deployment region or storage zone for the library.

usage_type.description: Defines how the library will be used.

description.description: Short summary of what this library is used for.

default_privacy.description: Sets the default privacy mode for uploaded assets.

tags.description: List of labels or keywords to categorize and quickly filter libraries (e.g., ["marketing", "training", "internal"]).

example.name: Product Launch Video
example.description: Videos for product launches and announcements.

data.description: Videos for product launches and announcements.

post.description: Create a new transcoding profile with video, audio, and AI settings

name.description: The name of the transcoding profile used to identify it within the library.

description.description: Short summary describing the purpose or usage of this profile.

format.description: Output container formats to generate (e.g., hls, dash).

video_codec.description: List of video codecs to use during encoding (e.g., h264).

per_title_encoding.description: Enables per-title encoding optimization to improve quality and bitrate efficiency. Default value is true.

url.description: URL of the image to overlay (e.g., watermark or logo).

position.description: Position of the overlay image on the video (e.g., top-right, bottom-left).

opacity.description: Transparency level of the overlay image (0â€“1).

width.description: Width of the overlay image in pixels.

height.description: Height of the overlay image in pixels.

x.description: Horizontal margin offset for the overlay position.

y.description: Vertical margin offset for the overlay position.

format.description: Output format for thumbnails (e.g., jpg, webp).

spritesheet.description: Whether to generate a spritesheet containing multiple thumbnails.

audio_language.description: Source audio language for auto-generated subtitles.

enabled.description: Enables Digital Rights Management (DRM) for protected playback.

signing_secret.description: Secret key used to sign Widevine DRM licenses.

license_proxy_url.description: URL of the Widevine license proxy server.

license_url.description: License server URL for FairPlay DRM.

certificate_url.description: Certificate URL for FairPlay DRM authorization.

application_service_key.description: Application key used for FairPlay authentication.

private_key_passphrase.description: Passphrase for the FairPlay private key.

basic_drm.description: Enables a simplified DRM protection mechanism.

mp4_access.description: Allows direct download or playback of MP4 files.

keep_original.description: Keeps the original source file after transcoding completes.

data.name: Vidinfra Ultra Secure Profile
data.description: 4K adaptive bitrate profile with AES encryption, DRM, watermark, and subtitle generation.

post.description: Create a player for your video, and customise it.

name.description: Name of the player configuration used to identify it within your account.

language.description: Default language code for interface text (e.g., en, es).

font_family.description: Font family used for player UI text.

custom_html.description: Custom HTML or script snippets to embed in the player.

playback_speeds.description: List of playback speed options available to users (e.g., 0.5x, 1x, 1.5x, 2x).

is_beta_enabled.description: Enables experimental or beta player features for testing.

is_default.description: Marks this player configuration as the default for all videos.

enable_resumable_position.description: Allows viewers to resume playback from their last watched position.

vast_tag_url.description: VAST ad tag URL for video ad integration. Leave empty if ads are not used.

enabled.description: Enables dynamic watermark display during playback.

font_size.description: Font size of the watermark text.

font_color.description: Text color of the watermark in HEX format (e.g., #FFFFFF).

background_color.description: Background color behind the watermark text.

interval.description: Interval in seconds for watermark position changes.

dynamic_watermark.description: Defines watermark display settings such as font, color, and movement interval.

facebook_pixel_id.description: Facebook Pixel ID for audience tracking and analytics.

google_analytics_id.description: Google Analytics ID for tracking player events.

analytics.description: Contains analytics integration details for tracking player performance and engagement.

primary_color.description: Primary color of the player interface (buttons, progress bar, etc.).

font_size.description: Default font size for UI text.

logo.description: URL of the logo displayed in the player (optional).

logo_destination_url.description: URL to open when the logo is clicked.

appearance.description: Controls the visual appearance of the player including colors, fonts, and logo.

loop.description: Enables loop playback mode for videos.

big_play_button.description: Shows the central play button overlay before playback starts.

progress.description: Displays the progress bar for playback tracking.

settings.description: Enables settings menu for resolution, captions, and speed options.

controls_visible.description: Keeps playback controls visible at all times.

preload_video_one_page_load.description: Preloads video data automatically when the page loads for faster playback start.

enable_download_button.description: Displays a download button to allow users to download the video.

airplay.description: Enables AirPlay streaming for Apple devices.

chromecast.description: Enables Chromecast support for casting playback to external devices.

controls.description: Defines player control visibility and functionality, including playback, captions, and casting options.

example.message: Could not determine authentication type from request. Please provide a valid Authorization header or X-API-Key header.

Retrieves detailed information about a specific video player within a library.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the targeted player resource.

example.message: Could not determine authentication type from request. Please provide a valid Authorization header or X-API-Key header.

put.description:
Updates the configuration or metadata of a specific video player within a library.
This endpoint allows partial updates, so only the fields provided in the request are modified.

parameters.name: playerId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the targeted player resource.

name.description: Name of the player configuration used to identify it within your account.

language.description: Default language code for captions and UI elements (e.g., 'en', 'es').

font_family.description: Font family used for captions and player interface text.

custom_html_head.description: Custom HTML or script snippets to include in the <head> section of the player (e.g., analytics tags).

custom_html_footer.description: Custom HTML or script snippets to include before the closing </body> tag.

playback_speeds.description: List of playback speed options available to users (e.g., 0.5x, 1x, 2x).

is_beta_enabled.description: Enables beta or experimental player features for testing.

is_default.description: Marks this player as the default configuration for all videos.

enable_resumable_position.description: Allows viewers to continue watching from their last playback position.

primary_color.description: Primary accent color of the player interface, used for buttons and progress bars.

caption_font_color.description: Text color of captions in HEX format (e.g., '#FFFFFF').

caption_background_color.description: Background color displayed behind caption text.

font_size.description: Base font size for player UI elements.

caption_font_size.description: Font size used specifically for captions or subtitles.

appearance.description: Defines appearance settings including colors and text sizes for the player.

backward.description: Enables the backward seek button for rewinding playback.

forward.description: Enables the forward seek button for fast-forwarding playback.

airplay.description: Enables AirPlay streaming support for Apple devices.

big_play_button.description: Displays the large central play button overlay before playback starts.

captions.description: Shows or hides the captions toggle button.

chromecast.description: Enables Chromecast streaming support for compatible devices.

current_time.description: Displays the current playback time indicator.

duration.description: Displays the total duration of the video.

mute.description: Shows the mute/unmute audio control button.

picture_in_picture.description: Enables Picture-in-Picture mode for multitasking playback.

play_pause.description: Shows the play/pause toggle button in the control bar.

progress.description: Displays the progress bar showing playback position.

settings.description: Displays the settings menu for quality, captions, and speed options.

volume.description: Shows the volume control slider for adjusting audio level.

controls.description: Defines the visibility and functionality of player control buttons and features.

example.message: Could not determine authentication type from request. Please provide a valid Authorization header or X-API-Key header.

put.description:
Create or update a chapter within a video.
If the chapter exists, it will be updated; otherwise, a new one will be created.

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the targeted video resource.

chapters.description: List of chapters to create or update within the video. Each chapter defines a time range and title.

title.description: The title or label of the chapter, displayed in the video player timeline.

start_time.description: The starting time of the chapter in seconds.

end_time.description: The ending time of the chapter in seconds.

order_index.description: Optional ordering position of the chapter in the list.

items.description: Defines a single video chapter, including title, duration range, and display order.

get.description: Retrieve the current security settings for a specific library, including access controls and privacy configurations.

example.message: Could not determine authentication type from request. Please provide a valid Authorization header or X-API-Key header.

put.description: Update a libraryâ€™s security configurations such as access level, allowed domains, or token-based restrictions.

referrers.description: Defines domain-level access control based on HTTP referrers.

action.description: Specifies whether the listed domains are 'allow' or 'block' actions.

values.description: List of domain names or patterns to allow or block (e.g., 'example.com', '*.trustedsite.com').

enabled.description: Determines whether referrer-based restrictions are active.

countries.description: Defines geo-based access control based on viewer country.

action.description: Specifies whether the listed countries are 'allow' or 'block' actions.

values.description: List of ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes to allow or block (e.g., 'US', 'BD', 'IN').

enabled.description: Determines whether country-based access restrictions are active.

video_privacy.description: Sets the default privacy level for videos. Possible values: 'public', 'private', or 'restricted'.

example.message: Could not determine authentication type from request. Please provide a valid Authorization header or X-API-Key header.

post.description:
Start a multipart upload session for a large video.
Vidinfra validates the file type and returns an uploadId for the client to upload chunks directly to S3.

filename.description: The original name of the file being uploaded, including its extension (e.g., 'video.mp4').

type.description: MIME type of the file (e.g., 'video/mp4', 'image/jpeg'). Used to validate and assign proper upload handling.

metadata.description: Additional metadata to associate the uploaded file with a specific library, folder, or tagging context.

libraryId.description: Unique identifier of the library where this file will be uploaded.

folderId.description: Unique identifier of the folder within the library where the file will be stored.

source.description: Source or origin of the upload (e.g., 'dashboard', 'api', 'integration').

tags.description: Optional list of tags to categorize or label the uploaded file.

example.message: Could not determine authentication type from request. Please provide a valid Authorization header or X-API-Key header.

get.description: Generate pre-signed URL for uploading a specific part

parameters.name: uploadId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the upload of the multipart upload.

parameters.name: partNumber
parameters.description: Part number of the multipart upload process.

post.description:
Triggered automatically during the video transcoding process to notify your system about status updates.
Sends video details such as ID, processing status, duration, and file sizes for real-time tracking or post-processing actions.

video_id.description: Unique identifier of the video that is being transcoded.

id.description: Unique identifier of the transcoding job or process.

status.description: Current status of the transcoding process (e.g., 'queued', 'processing', 'completed', 'failed').

duration.description: Total duration of the transcoded video in seconds.

size.description: Size of the final transcoded video file in bytes.

raw_size.description: Size of the original source video file in bytes before transcoding.

provider.description: Specifies the source platform or service provider to migrate from (e.g., 'vimeo', 'youtube', 'bunny').

access_token.description: Access token or API key used to authorize migration requests with the source provider.

credentials.description: Authentication credentials required to access and migrate data from the source provider.
